response:
reasoning='1.  Polygon ROI is defined by the rectangle with vertices (2,2), (2,7), (7,7), (7,2).  Pixels strictly inside therefore satisfy 2 < row < 7 and 2 < col < 7 → rows 3-6 and columns 3-6 (0-based).
2.  Extracted 16 interior intensities (row-major order):
   [30, 33, 36, 39,
    32, 35, 38, 41,
    34, 37, 40, 43,
    36, 39, 42, 45]
3.  First-order statistics
   • Mean = Σx / 16 = 600 / 16 = 37.5
   • Sample variance (N-1): Σ(x-mean)² / 15 = 260 / 15 = 17.3333
   • Skewness: central third moment μ₃ = 0 (perfect symmetry) → skewness = 0
   • Kurtosis: μ₂ = 16.25; μ₄ = 586.0625; excess kurtosis = μ₄/μ₂² − 3 = (9377/4225) − 3 = −0.780592 → −0.7806
4.  Horizontal GLCM (offset [0,1]) inside ROI: 4 rows × 3 pairs = 12 neighbouring pairs; every pair has intensity step +3, so |i-j|² = 9 for all 12 pairs.
   Normalised GLCM probability for each pair = 1/12.  Contrast = Σ|i-j|²·p(i,j) = 12·9 / 12 = 9.
5.  Rounded (4 decimals):
   Mean 37.5000, Variance 17.3333, Skewness 0.0000, Kurtosis −0.7806, Contrast 9.0000' config=RadiomicsOutput(mean=37.5, variance=17.3333, skewness=0.0, kurtosis=-0.7806, contrast=9.0)
evaluation_result:
Mean intensity value of the ROI is wrong.
Sample variance of intensity values in the ROI is wrong.
Skewness of intensity distribution in the ROI is correct.
Excess kurtosis of intensity distribution in the ROI is wrong.
GLCM contrast feature computed from ROI pixels is correct.
